# Part 1: Getting Started with Quarto

## Installation & Setup

Install Quarto from [quarto.org](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/)

```bash
# Verify installation
quarto --version

# Create a new project
quarto create-project my-website --type website
```

## Project Structure

```
my-website/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ _quarto.yml          # Main configuration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.qmd            # Home page
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ about.qmd            # About page
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ research.qmd         # Research page
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ cv.pdf               # CV document
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ styles.css           # Custom styles
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ _site/               # Generated output (don't commit)
```

# Part 2: Core YAML Configuration

## Basic Website YAML

```yaml
project:
  type: website
  output-dir: _site

website:
  title: "My Quarto Website"
  site-url: https://yourusername.github.io/my-website/
  
  navbar:
    left:
      - text: "Home"
        href: index.qmd
      - text: "About"
        href: about.qmd
      - text: "Research"
        href: research.qmd
      - text: "CV"

```

# Part 4: Git & GitHub Setup

## Initialize Git Repository

```bash
# Navigate to your project
cd my-website

# Initialize git
git init

# Add all files
git add .

# Create initial commit
git commit -m "Initial commit: Quarto website setup"
```

---

## GitHub Configuration

```bash
# Create repository on GitHub first
# (https://github.com/new)

# Add remote origin
git remote add origin https://github.com/yourusername/my-website.git

# Rename branch to main
git branch -M main

# Push to GitHub
git push -u origin main
```

## .gitignore File

```
# Ignore site output
_site/
.quarto/

# Ignore system files
.DS_Store
Thumbs.db

# Ignore IDE
.vscode/
.idea/

# Ignore dependencies
renv/
```

---

# Part 5: Publishing to GitHub Pages

## Enable GitHub Pages

1. Go to Repository Settings
2. Navigate to "Pages" section
3. Select "Deploy from a branch"
4. Choose branch: `main`
5. Select folder: `/ (root)` or `/docs`

## Automated Publishing with Quarto

Add to `_quarto.yml`:

```yaml
project:
  type: website
  output-dir: docs  # For GitHub Pages root

publish:
  - source: .
    netlify:
      - id: mysite
        url: https://mysite.netlify.app
```

---

## Deploy Workflow

```bash
# Make changes locally
nano about.qmd

# Render the site
quarto render

# Stage changes
git add .

# Commit
git commit -m "Update about page"

# Push to GitHub
git push origin main

# Site automatically updates!
```

# Part 6: Advanced Customization

## Custom CSS Styling

Create `styles.css`:

```css
/* Navigation bar */
.navbar {
  background: linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea 0%, #764ba2 100%);
  padding: 1rem 2rem;
}

/* Main content */
body {
  font-family: 'Segoe UI', Tahoma, Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif;
  line-height: 1.6;
}

/* Headers */
h1, h2, h3 {
  color: #333;
  margin-top: 1.5rem;
}

/* Sidebar */
.quarto-sidebar {
  background-color: #f8f9fa;
  padding: 1rem;
}
```

## Create a Blog Section

Add to `_quarto.yml`:

```yaml
website:
  navbar:
    left:
      - text: "Blog"
        href: blog/index.qmd

  listing:
    - id: blog-listing
      contents: "blog/*.qmd"
      sort: "date desc"
      type: default
      fields: [date, title, reading-time]
```

# Part 7: Troubleshooting & Best Practices

## Common Issues

**Issue:** _site folder not rendering

```bash
# Clean and rebuild
quarto clean
quarto render
```

**Issue:** Changes not pushing to GitHub

```bash
# Check git status
git status

# Verify remote
git remote -v
```

---

## Best Practices

‚úÖ Commit frequently with clear messages

‚úÖ Keep local `_site/` folder in `.gitignore`

‚úÖ Use descriptive YAML configurations

‚úÖ Test locally before pushing:
```bash
quarto preview
```

‚úÖ Keep content organized in folders

‚úÖ Use relative paths for links

‚ùå Don't commit generated files
